intro: Crotalaria goiasensis, commonly known as the Goiasensis cowpea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Crotalaria goiasensis is also noted for its potential use in agricultural systems due to its ability to improve soil fertility.
